t: Mark 11
The Triumphal Entry
As*p they approached Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany, near the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples,

and said to them, “Go*r into*r the*r village*r opposite*r you,*r and*r immediately*r as*r you*r enter*r it,*r you*r will*r find*r a*r colt*r tied*r there,*ir on*r which*r no*r one*r yet*r has*r ever*r sat;*r untie*r it*r and*r bring*r it*r here.*ir
If*r anyone*r says*r to*r you,*r ‘Why*r are*r you*r doing*r this?’*r you*r say,*r ‘The*r Lord*r has*r need*r of*r it’;*r and*r immediately*r he*r will*r send*r it*r back*r here.”*r
They went away and found a colt tied at the door, outside in the street; and they untied it.
Some of the bystanders were saying to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”
They spoke to them just as Jesus had told them,*i and they gave them permission.
They brought the colt to Jesus and put their coats on it; and He sat on it.
And many spread their coats in the road, and others spread*i leafy branches which they had cut from the fields.
Those who went in front and those who followed were shouting: “Hosanna!*pn Blessed*sln is*s He*s who*s comes*s in*s the*s name*s of*s the*s Lord;*s
Blessed*ln is*i the coming kingdom of our father David; Hosanna*ln in the highest!”
Jesus*p entered Jerusalem and*i came*i into the temple; and after looking around at everything, He left for Bethany with the twelve, since it was already late.
On*p the next day, when they had left Bethany, He became hungry.
Seeing at a distance a fig tree in leaf, He went to*i see*i if perhaps He would find anything on it; and when He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
He said to it, “May*r no*r one*r ever*r eat*r fruit*r from*r you*r again!”*r And His disciples were listening.
Jesus Drives Money Changers from the Temple

Then*p they came to Jerusalem. And He entered the temple and began to drive out those who were buying and selling in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves;
and He would not permit anyone to carry merchandise through the temple.

And He began*i to teach and say to them, “Is*r it*r not*r written,*r ‘My*sr house*sr shall*sr be*sr called*sr a*sr house*sr of*sr prayer*sr for*sr all*sr the*sr nations’?*sr But*r you*r have*r made*r it*r a*r robbers*sr ’den.”*sr
The chief priests and the scribes heard this,*i and began*i seeking how to destroy Him; for they were afraid of Him, for the whole crowd was astonished at His teaching.
When*p evening came, they would go out of the city.
As*p they were passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots up.*i
Being reminded, Peter said to Him, “Rabbi, look, the fig tree which You cursed has withered.”
And Jesus answered saying to them, “Have*r faith*r in*r God.*r

Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r whoever*r says*r to*r this*r mountain,*r ‘Be*r taken*r up*r and*r cast*r into*r the*r sea,’*r and*r does*r not*r doubt*r in*r his*r heart,*r but*r believes*r that*r what*r he*r says*r is*r going*r to*r happen,*r it*r will*r be*r granted*ir him.*r
Therefore*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r all*r things*r for*r which*r you*r pray*r and*r ask,*r believe*r that*r you*r have*r received*r them,*r and*r they*r will*r be*r granted*ir you.*r

Whenever*r you*r stand*r praying,*r forgive,*r if*r you*r have*r anything*r against*r anyone,*r so*r that*r your*r Father*r who*r is*r in*r heaven*r will*r also*r forgive*r you*r your*r transgressions.*r
[But*r if*r you*r do*r not*r forgive,*r neither*r will*r your*r Father*r who*r is*r in*r heaven*r forgive*r your*r transgressions.”]*r
Jesus’ Authority Questioned
They*p came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to Him,
and began*i saying to Him, “By what authority are You doing these things, or who gave You this authority to do these things?”
And Jesus said to them, “I*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r question,*r and*r you*r answer*r Me,*r and*r then*ir I*r will*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r
Was*r the*r baptism*r of*r John*r from*r heaven,*r or*r from*r men?*r Answer*r Me.”*r
They began*i reasoning among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
But shall we say, ‘From men’?”—they were afraid of the people, for everyone considered John to have been a real prophet.
Answering Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Nor*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.”*r
